creator.name: Gouverneur-Generaal van de Nederlandse West-Indsiche Bezittingen
creator.name_english: Governor-General of the Netherlands West Indian Possessions
creator.his_func: In 1828 the administration of the Dutch colonial possessions in the Caribbean was reorganised. The highest authority was held by a Governor-General, who resided in Paramaribo and who also acted as Governor of Suriname. The six Antillean islands were organized into three administrative units: Curaçao and its dependencies Aruba and Bonaire; St Martin; St Eustatius and its dependency Saba. The highest authority in both military and civil affairs was entrusted to Directors. These persons were accountable to the Governor-General in Paramaribo and no longer to the Ministry of the Colonies directly.
